casebody.data:
Case No. 6,584a.HOGAN v. TAYLOR.

[Hempst. 20.] 1

Superior Court, Territory of Arkansas.Aug., 1822.Judgment — Amount Claimed.The judgment cannot exceed the amount claimed in the declaration.[This was a suit by Edmund P. Hogan against Creed Taylor.]

[Eeported by Samuel H. Hempstead, Esq.J

 PEE CUKIAM.

■ The judgment in this case being, rendered for fifty dollars more than the amount claimed in the declaration, is manifestly erroneous, and must be reversed; it being well established, that a greater amount cannot be given than claimed in the declaration. 1 Chit. Pl. 372; Yel. 45; 10 Coke, 117; 3 Com. Dig. tit. “Damages,” E. 3. Eeversed.
